source.title: Evaluation of the FMC FT-180 Fast Track Log Skidder
source.notes: Performance comparison of an FMC FT-180 tracked skidder and a John Deere 550 crawler on 35–60% clearcut slopes and a winter right-of-way (≤9% running slope) in the Columbia Valley.

sites.description: Summer clearcut, sidehill slopes 35–60%. Prepared skid trails; average tree volume 0.39 m³.
Winter road right-of-way (maximum running-surface slope 9%). Average tree volume 1.70 m³.

machines.name: FMC FT-180 Fast Track skidder
machines.notes: Prototype small tracked skidder intended to work on 30–50% slopes. Contractor kept it focused on larger skids; JD 550 bunched/cleaned in the clearcut.

machines.name: John Deere 550 crawler tractor
machines.notes: Performed trail construction, landing cleanup, short skids, and bunching for the FT-180 during clearcut cleanup.

system_notes: FT-180 maintained ≥50% higher m³/PMH than the JD 550 on both areas. Contractor emphasized longer skids for the FT-180 while the JD handled short hauls, trail building, and landing tasks.
Right-of-way figures cover winter operations with 1.7 m³ trees; clearcut figures cover smaller 0.39 m³ stems.
No separate owning/operating cost splits published; treat these values as productivity benchmarks for steep ground tracked skidders.
